mil.emp3.mapengine.interfaces

Interface IMapInstance

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CoreMapInstance

    public interface IMapInstance
    EMP is loosely split into three layers, namely API, Core and Map Engine. The API and Core together insulate the application from specific Map Engine implementations. IMapInstance insulates the EMP Core from specific map engine API. In the current implementation EMP supports NASA World Wind map engine. If you want to support a map engine other than NASA World Wind then you will need to implement IMpaInstance interface along with other interfaces in this package. EMP also allows for multiple instances of same or different map engines to be present and active in a single application. Implementors of IMapInstance must allow for multiple instances of one or more map engines to operate side-by-side in a single instance of an application. Instances of map engine can either be compiled into the application or can be loaded from a self contained android application.

        IMapEngineProperties getMapEngineProperties()

        Returns:
        See IMapEngineProperties

      • getCapabilities

        IMapEngineCapabilities getCapabilities()
        This method is called by the EMP core to identify the map instances capabilities. It is used to ensure that the core does NOT attempt an operation on the map engine that it does not support.
        Returns:
        See IMapEngineCapabilities

      • getRequirements

        IMapEngineRequirements getRequirements()
        This method retrieves the map engine's requirement set. It is queried by the core to properly access the map engines capabilities.
        Returns:
        IMapEngineRequirements

      • getCapture

        void getCapture(IScreenCaptureCallback callback)
        This method is called to retrieve an image of the current viewing area of the map.
        Parameters:
        callback - An implementation of the IScreenCaptureCallback interface. The EMP core ensures that this parameter is not null. Therefore a map engine implementation does not need to check for null. Any exception generated during the process must invoke the failure callback with the exception as the parameter. Upon success the map implementation must call the success callback with the ICapture object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the map engine does not support screen capture operation.

      • addFeatures

        void addFeatures(FeatureVisibilityList features,
                 java.lang.Object userContext)
        This method is called by the EMP core to add features to the map.
        Parameters:
        features - The list of one or more feature to add to the map. See FeatureVisibilityList
        userContext - user defined object

      • removeFeatures

        void removeFeatures(IUUIDSet features,
                    java.lang.Object userContext)
        This method is called by the EMP core to remove features from the map.
        Parameters:
        features - The list of one or more unique Id of features to remove from the map.
        userContext - user defined object

      • addMapService

        void addMapService(IMapService mapService)
        This method is called by the EMP core to add a service to the map.
        Parameters:
        mapService - The list of one or more map services to add to the map.

      • removeMapService

        void removeMapService(IMapService mapService)
        This method is called by the EMP core to remove map services from the map.
        Parameters:
        mapService - The list of one or more map services to remove from the map.

      • getCamera

        ICamera getCamera()
        This method is used to retrieve the map's current camera.
        Returns:
        See ICamera

      • setCamera

        void setCamera(ICamera oCamera,
               boolean animate,
               java.lang.Object userContext)
        This method is used to set the camera for the map. It is the responsibility of IMapInstance to keep the EMP Camera and map engine camera in sync.
        Parameters:
        oCamera - The new setting. See ICamera
        animate - If set to true then animate to new position
        userContext - user defined object

      • applyCameraChange

        void applyCameraChange(ICamera oCamera,
                       boolean animate,
                       java.lang.Object userContext)
        This method is used to update camera setting. Camera settings are updated only if oCamera is the currentCamera. This method is invoked as a result of application invoking ICamera.apply();
        Parameters:
        oCamera -
        animate -
        userContext - user defined object

      • setLookAt

        void setLookAt(ILookAt oLookAt,
               boolean animate,
               java.lang.Object userContext)
        This method is used to set the lookAt for the map. It is the responsibility of IMapInstance to keep the EMP LookAt and map engine LookAt in sync.
        Parameters:
        oLookAt - The new setting. See ILookAt
        animate - If set to true then animate to new position
        userContext - user defined object

      • applyLookAtChange

        void applyLookAtChange(ILookAt oLookAt,
                       boolean animate,
                       java.lang.Object userContext)
        This method is used to update lookAt settings. LookAt settings are updated only if oLookAt is the current LookAt. This method is invoked as a result of application invoking ILookAt.apply();
        Parameters:
        oLookAt - The new setting. See ILookAt
        animate - If set to true then animate to new position
        userContext - user defined object

      • getLookAt

        ILookAt getLookAt()
        This method is used to retrieve the map current LookAt.
        Returns:
        See ILookAt

      • addMapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener

        void addMapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener(MapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener listener)
        This method is called by the core to register a Feature user interaction event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEvent each time the user performs any of the actions defined in UserInteractionEventEnum on a feature currently visible on the map.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener

      • addMapInstanceStateChangeEventListener

        void addMapInstanceStateChangeEventListener(MapInstanceStateChangeEventListener listener)
        This method is called by the core to register a map state change event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceStateChangeEvent each time the map changes from one state (See MapStateEnum) to another.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceStateChangeEventListener

      • addMapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener

        void addMapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener(MapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener listener)
        This method is called by the core to register a map user interaction event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceUserInteractionEvent each time the user performs any of the actions defined in UserInteractionEventEnum on the map.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener

      • addMapInstanceViewChangeEventListener

        void addMapInstanceViewChangeEventListener(MapInstanceViewChangeEventListener listener)
        This method is called by the core to register a map view change event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceViewChangeEvent each time the map's viewing area is changed. The map engine implementation must ensure that an excessive number of consecutive map view change events are not generated. I.E. continuous view change events due to animation should not be generated.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceViewChangeEventListener

      • addMapInstanceFeatureAddedEventListener

        void addMapInstanceFeatureAddedEventListener(MapInstanceFeatureAddedEventListener listener)
        This method is called by the core to register a feature added event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a FeatureAddEvent each time a feature is added to the map using addFeature method.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceFeatureAddedEvent

      • addMapInstanceFeatureRemovedEventListener

        void addMapInstanceFeatureRemovedEventListener(MapInstanceFeatureRemovedEventListener listener)
        This method is called by the core to register a feature removed event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a FeatureRemovedEvent each time a feature is removed from the map using removeFeature method.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceFeatureRemovedEvent

      • setBounds

        void setBounds(IGeoBounds bounds)
        This method sets the maps viewing area to the coordinates contained in the bounding box provided.
        Parameters:
        bounds -

      • setMotionLockMode

        void setMotionLockMode(MapMotionLockEnum mode)
        This method sets the map's motion lock.
        Parameters:
        mode - see MapMotionLockEnum

      • registerMilStdRenderer

        void registerMilStdRenderer(IMilStdRenderer oRenderer)
        This method is called by the core to register a MilStd renderer with the map instance. The instance must call this renderer to obtain the basic shapes of a MilStd feature.
        Parameters:
        oRenderer - see IMilStdRenderer

      • getFieldOfView

        double getFieldOfView()
        Returns field of view. Currently used by the core for zoomIt calculations.
        Returns:
        field of view in degrees

      • getViewHeight

        int getViewHeight()
        Returns height of the view.
        Returns:

      • getViewWidth

        int getViewWidth()
        Returns height of the view.
        Returns:

      • setFarDistanceThreshold

        void setFarDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
        This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons as dots.
        Parameters:
        dValue - Distance in meters.

      • setMidDistanceThreshold

        void setMidDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
        This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons with no modifiers. Icons at distances less than this threshold get displayed as fully qualified icons as per the label setting.
        Parameters:
        dValue - Distance in meters.

      • getVersionInformation

        void getVersionInformation(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> buildConfigFields)
        Returns version information for the map engine

        a screen X,Y coordinate for the provided GeoPosition.

      • deselectFeatures

        Instructs the map instance to render the features in the list with their normal style. obtained from the core.
        Parameters:
        featureList -

      • setFontSizeModifier

        void setFontSizeModifier(FontSizeModifierEnum value)
        Sets the font size modifier for the map.
        Parameters:
        value - FontSizeModifierEnum

      • getFontSizeModifier

        FontSizeModifierEnum getFontSizeModifier()
        Returns the font size modifier
        Returns:

      • showMiniMap

        android.view.View showMiniMap()
        This method creates a mini map associated with the map instance. The android View containing the map is returned to the client. It is the responsibility of the client to add the view to a parent. All touch events must be forwarded to the parent of the View. If the mini map has already been created the same view must be returned.
        Returns:
        android.view.View

      • hideMiniMap

        void hideMiniMap()
        This method destroys the mini map. The call must remove the view from its parent if it still has a parent. If the mini map has already been destroyed no action should be taken. All resources associated with the mini map must be freed.

      • setBackgroundBrightness

        void setBackgroundBrightness(int setting)
        This method set the brightness of the background maps on the map.
        Parameters:
        setting - Range 0 - 100. 0 Black, 100 white. Values less than 0 are set to 0, and values greater then 100 are set to 100.

      • getBackgroundBrightness

        int getBackgroundBrightness()
        This method retrieves the current background brightness setting of the map.
        Returns:
        Return the current value 0 - 100.

      • setMapGridGenerator

        void setMapGridGenerator(IMapGridLines gridGenerator)
        This method set the map grid generator on the map.
        Parameters:
        gridGenerator - IMapGridLines

      • scheduleMapRedraw

        void scheduleMapRedraw()
        This method causes a draw to be scheduled on the map.
